Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Gertrudis Barbosa-Salas, Michael Lucena-Cortes, Aidin Sojo-Luciano held on 7/9/2010. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. At the request of the US Probation Office, due to the number of defendants in these indictments, plus the remoteness of the place where the initials were going to take place, the Court granted waiving the financial affidavits at this time. If needed, and at the request be it from the Government or Probation, the CJA-23 forms will be filled at the time of the arraignments. US Probation also provided the pertinent financial information as to each defendant to the Court. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 7/14/2010 at 01:30 PM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants were ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 07/14/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were AUSA Olga Castellon and SAUSA A. Lopez-Rocafort, Ms. Irma Valldejuli and PTO E. Jimenez.Arraignment as to Fernando Torres-Ruiz (12) Count 1,2- 3,4 held on 7/15/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of  not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to Fernando Torres-Ruiz held on 7/15/2010. AUSA Castellon stated that they were opposing bail due to defendant's severe drug use. Ms. Valldejuli stated that defendant's family had no money to post as bail, but that he had siblings living outside PR who would be willing to take care of him and provide substance abuse treatment. The Court set bail in an inpatient substance abuse program as recommended by PT, but that defendant had to take the decision to attend program, UA, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 03:29.Hearing ended at 03:32. (yr) (Entered: 07/22/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were SAUSA A. Lopez-Rocafort and AUSA Olga Castellon, Mr. Elfrick Mendez and PTO E. Jimenez.Arraignment as to Bryan Pagan-Dieppa (26) Count 1,2-3,4 held on 7/15/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to Bryan Pagan-Dieppa held on 7/15/2010. AUSA Castellon stated that the Government didn't oppose bail as to this defendant. Mr. Mendez stated that defendant had an aunt who lived outside the housing project and would be willing to offer him housing. The Court set bail in the amount of $15,000.00 unsecured, UA and/or treatment, he's to reside outside the housing project and not to enter or approach any of the locations mentioned in the indictments, plus all other standard conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Bail Hearing as to Rodderick Perez-Gonzalez held on 8/3/2010. AUSA Alberto Lopez and defense counsel Francisco Adams were present. The Government proffered as to defendant's role and/or participation in the case and requested detention without bail. Defense counsel proffered that relatives are willing to post bail, that defendant wear an electronic monitoring device and is will comply with any release conditions. Defendant was presently complying with release conditions in the state court. The Court ordered defense to file motion as to the outcome of the preliminary hearing in the state court. Meanwhile, the Court finds defendant to be a risk of flight and ordered defendant detained without bail pending trial. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez.) (Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:15. Hearing ended at 09:20. (br) (Entered: 08/03/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Show Cause Hearing as to Bryan Pagan-Dieppa held on 8/5/2010. Present were SAUSA Alberto Lopez-Rocafort, Mr. Elfrick Mendez and PO J. Santana. Mr. Mendez stated that defendant would not contest the Probation Officer's request and would accept being placed at Casa Alborada since there were no other family members available to provide him housing. The Court modified defendant's conditions of release as to his place of residence, but advised both the attorney and the defendant, that if situation  changed and a family member comes forward who could give him a place to live, to advise the court. The Court also advised defendant that he would be residing at Casa Alborada, but that all other conditions of release previously set would remain in effect and that he had to abide by them. The US Probation Office will make the necessary arrangements as to his moving to Casa Alborada. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Ani Navarro.)Hearing set for 11:00.Hearing held at 11:25.Hearing ended at 11:29. (yr) (Entered: 08/06/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were SAUSA Alberto Lopez-Rocafort, Mr. Francisco Dolz and PTO E. Jimenez. Arraignment as to Mariselis Morales-Fradera (21) Count 1,2-3,4 held on 8/9/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Delgado-Colon for trial scheduling. Bail Hearing as to Mariselis Morales-Fradera held on 8/9/2010. Mr. Dolz stated that at this time they had nothing to rebut the presumption, but that defendant requested that she be sent back to the Women's Prison in Vega Alta where she was working while serving time and with the money she earned she was helping her family. Sidebar as to this matter held. The Government expressed no objection that defendant be remanded to state prison. The Court granted the request and issued a separate order so that the USM would transfer the defendant back to Vega Alta, with a detainer so that when her time there is completed, she is returned to MDC and the Court be notified. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:17.Hearing ended at 02:25. (yr) (Entered: 08/10/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Alberto Lopez and PO, Adrian Oliveros. Defense counsel, Maria Sandoval is not present in Court. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C). Bail Review Hearing NOT HELD as to Amarilis Torres-Rivera on 11/18/2010. The Court states to the defendant that the hearing can't be held because defense counsel Sandoval is not present in Court. The Court further states that maybe there is no need to hold this hearing. The Court is provided with a copy of video N-58, the portion at issue which is the one the Court wants to examine, where defense counsel says that defendant is not selling narcotics. The Court inquires from the Government if he disputes that characterization of the video to which Counsel for the government states, that he does not. The Court states that if that is the case, the Court will vacate the bail review hearing and will not reschedule the same. The Court grants the Government until November 30, 2010 to supplement the motion that the Government had filed and articulate as to why it is not exculpatory. Counsel Sandoval is order to show cause by November 30, 2010 as to why sanctions should not be imposed for her failure to appear at this hearing. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:30.Hearing ended at 02:37. (mn) Modified on 1/4/2011 to eliminate not related text(ov). Attorney Estades informs that no plea agreement has been reached as to her client Osvaldo Ferrer (5). Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Further Status Conference as to Guillermo Casiano-Arce held on 6/2/2011. SAUSA Cesar Rivera and defense counsel Wilfredo Rios are present. Government informs that a verbal plea offer was recently extended. Will meet today with the defense to discuss the discovery provided and a proposed plea agreement will be extended as well. Defense counsel informs that he doesn't anticipate that his client will be going to trial. The Court sets a Further Status Conference for 6/29/2011 at 1:30 PM in Courtroom 1 before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. Plea cut-off date due by 6/29/2011. The period of June 2-29, 2011, which is being allocated for plea negotiations, is excludable under STA. It's also in the best interest of justice for the defendant who doesn't anticipate exercising his right to go to trial. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Hearing set for 1:30 p.m. Hearing held at 3:23 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:40 p.m. (sr) (Entered: 06/03/2011)

ORDER denying as to Omayra Segarra-Lopez (By Order of the Court) re 991 MOTION for Retroactive Application of Sentencing Guidelines to Crack Cocaine Offense 18 USC 3582 filed by Omayra Segarra-Lopez By Order of the Court: In view of the recommendation of the United States Probation Officer (Docket No. 1000) in relation to defendant Omayra Segarra Lopez's motion for retroactive application of Sentencing Guidelines as to crack cocaine, and reduction of sentence pursuant to U.S.S.G. Sec. 1B1.10 as amended and 18 U.S.C. 3582(c)(2)(Docket No. 991), and there being no opposition to the recommendation of the U.S. Probation Officer, said recommendation is adopted and the motion for retroactive application of Sentencing Guidelines is Denied. Defendant's sentence was based on cocaine and not crack cocaine or cocaine base. She is therefore not eligible for sentence reduction. Signed by U.S. Magistrate Judge Justo Arenas on 4/2/2013.(Arenas, Justo) (Entered: 04/02/2013)

AUSA Desiree Laborde and AFPD Hector Ramos were present. Defense counsel informed that defendant wish to waive the hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jesus Vila-Barbosa (13) held on 2/17/2016. Present were AUSA Cesar Rivera and Mr. Jedrick Burgos. Defendant was present and under custody. The Government called to testify USPO Ricardo Cruz. Direct and cross- examination conducted. During the cross Mr. Burgos requested copy of the Kronos for this defendant. The same had to be obtained and redacted in order to provide the copy. A break was taken and the matter was resumed at 1:30. After hearing the testimony of the  witness and the arguments from the parties, the Court made a finding of probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motions filed by Probation in dockets 1226 and 1241, and referred the matter to Chief Judge Delgado for the full revocation hearing. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Ismael Crespo-Quijano (28) held on 2/15/2017. Present were SAUSA Nadia Pineda, USPO Ricardo Cruz, and AFPD Juan Michelen. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found and the matter referred to Chief Judge Delgado for scheduling of the full hearing. AFPD Michelen requested reconsideration as to the issue of granting temporary bail. The Government requested that a motion be filed to the Presider. The Court contacted the chambers of the Chief Judge Delgado, who referred to USMJ Velez the issue of bail. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jose Rivera-Colon (25) held on 4/19/2021. Present: AUSA Daynelle Alvarez-Lora and AFPD Jesus Hernandez- Garcia. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Brenda Nieves at Docket No. 1467 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Court directly appointed CJA Counsel Richard O. Dansoh to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States' case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence,  adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 4/29/2021 at 2:00 PM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English language.(Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording. )Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:06. Hearing ended at 02:12. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (mig) (Entered: 04/20/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jose Rivera-Colon (25) held on 4/29/2021. Present: AUSA Linet Suarez, defense counsel Richard Dansoh and USPO Guillermo Arbona. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC.
